wikipedia_page.main:
Richard Newcombe (1779 – 1857) was an Anglican priest.Newcombe was educated at Queens' College, Cambridge. He held incumbencies at Llanrhyddlad, Llanfwrog and Clocaenog.
He died on 7 August 1857.

response: The manuscript then disappeared for over a century. It was unexpectedly rediscovered in 1910 in a cupboard in a disused bedroom of the mansion of Hendregadredd near Porthmadog: a note found inside, written by the Archdeacon of Merioneth, Richard Newcombe (1779-1857), stated "I have long been in possession of this Welsh MS. but forget where or how I obtained it".Breeze, Andrew R.: Medieval Welsh Literature, Four Courts Press, 1997, p.30 –  It is now part of the collection of the National Library of Wales with catalogue number NLW MS 6680B.
